intro: Matricaria cantoniensis, commonly known as the Chinese chamomile, is a flowering plant native to southern China. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its daisy-like flowers with white petals and a yellow center. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and thrives in well-drained soil. Its leaves are serrated and aromatic, often used in traditional Chinese medicine. The flowers are harvested for their essential oils, which are valued for their calming and anti-inflammatory properties.
